verse: Some Pharisees and scribes came from Jerusalem to ask Jesus a question.
Jesus turned the Pharisees’ question back on them.
Later the disciples came to Him.
Jesus left that place and withdrew to Tyre and Sidon.
A Canaanite woman—a non-Jew—came to Him.
Jesus said nothing. And the woman continued to wail. His disciples came to Him.
The woman came up to Jesus and knelt before Him.
Jesus—whose ancestors included Ruth and Rahab—spoke with kindness and insight.
Jesus left and went to the Sea of Galilee. He went up on a mountaintop and sat down.
Crowds thronged to Him there, bringing the lame, the maimed, the blind, the crippled, the mute, and many other sick and broken people. They laid them at His feet, and He healed them.
The people saw the mute speaking, the lame walking, the maimed made whole, the crippled dancing, and the blind seeing; and the people were amazed, and they praised the God of Israel.
He told the crowd to sit down.
He took the bread and the fish, He gave thanks, and then He broke the bread and divided the fish. He gave the bread and fish to the disciples, the disciples distributed them to the people,
and everyone ate and was satisfied. When everyone had eaten, the disciples picked up seven baskets of crusts and broken pieces and crumbs.
There were 4,000 men there, not to mention all the women and children.
Then Jesus sent the crowd away. He got into the boat and went to Magadan.
